title: ISic000083. Funerary inscription for Iulia Florentina
body:
1Iuliae Floren͡tinae in͡fan<t>i dulcissimae atq(ue) in-
2nocentissimae fideli factae parens conlocavit
3quae pridie nonas Martias an͡te lucem pagana
4nata Zoilo corr(ectore) p(rovinciae) mense octavo decimo et vices<i>-
5ma secunda die completis fidelis facta hora no-
6ctis octava ultimum spiritum agens supervixit
7horis quattuor ita ut consueta repet͡eret ac de-
8<f>uncta Hyble hora die(i) prima septimum kal(endas)
9Octobres cuius occasum cum uterq(ue) parens om-
10ni momen͡to fleret p<e>r noctem ma͡iestatis
11vox extitit quae defunctam lamen<t>ari prohi-
12beret cuius corpus pro foribus mart(yrum) ΧΡ(istian)orum cu<m>
13loculo suo per prosbiterum humatu(m) e(st) IIII non(as) Oct(o)br(es)

l.4 i | l.8 f | l.10 e | l.12 m

1IULIAEFLOREN͡TINAEIN͡FANIDULCISSIMAEATQIN
2NOCENTISSIMAEFIDELIFACTAEPARENSCONLOCAVIT
3QUAEPRIDIENONASMARTIASAN͡TELUCEMPAGANA
4NATAZOILOCORRPMENSEOCTAVODECIMOETVICEST
5MASECUNDADIECOMPLETISFIDELISFACTAHORANO
6CTISOCTAVAULTIMUMSPIRITUMAGENSSUPERVIXIT
7HORISQUATTUORITAUTCONSUETAREPET͡ERETACDE
8EUNCTAHYBLEHORADIEPRIMASEPTIMUMKAL
9OCTOBRESCUIUSOCCASUMCUMUTERQPARENSOM
10NIMOMEN͡TOFLERETPFRNOCTEMMA͡IESTATIS
11VOXEXTITITQUAEDEFUNCTAMLAMENARIPROHI
12BERETCUIUSCORPUSPROFORIBUSMARTΧΡORUMCUAX
13LOCULOSUOPERPROSBITERUMHUMATUEIIIINONOCTBR

l.4 i | l.8 f | l.10 e | l.12 m

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text controlled against photograph

English translation

Jonathan Prag

To Iulia Florentina, a most sweet and innocent child, who became an adherent of the faith, (this monument) her father has set up. She was born a pagan before dawn on the day before the Nones of March (= 6 March) in the year that Zoilus was corrector (= governor) of the province, and having lived 18 months and 22 days she was made faithful (i.e. became a Christian) at the eighth hour of the night, when breathing her last, and survived four hours returned to her former self. She died at Hybla at the first hour on the seventh day before the Kalends of October (= 25 September). While both parents at every moment throughout the night were lamenting her death, the voice of majesty issued forth to order them not to week over the dead girl. Her body was buried by the presbyter in her Christian grave in front of the doors of the Shrine of the Christian Martyrs on the fourth day before the Nones of October (= 3 October).

Italian translation

Serena Agodi

A Iulia Florentina, infante dolcissima e innocentissima, divenuta fedele, il padre pose; lei, il giorno prima delle none di marzo (= 6 marzo) prima del far del giorno, nata pagana, mentre Zoilos era correttore della provincia, a 18 mesi e a 22 giorni compiuti divenuta fedele, all'ora ottava della notte rendendo l'ultimo sospiro, sopravvisse quattro ore sì da ripetere gli atti consueti, e morì a Ibla la prima ora del giorno, sette giorni prima delle calende di ottobre (= 25 settembre). [...] Il suo corpo [si trova] davanti alle porte dei martiri dove nel proprio loculo è stato inumato per mezzo del presbitero 4 giorni prima delle none di ottobre (= 3 ottobre).

commentary

A cast of the inscription is preserved in the Museo Civico di Catania, the original is in the Louvre.

  • 1995.0688 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283

  • Agnello 1953 no.85 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002211
  • Manganaro 1958-1959 10-15 no.2 fig.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001856
  • Ducroux 1975 224, no.854 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002633
  • Bonacasa Carra 1982-1983 422-423 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002133
  • Bitto 1989 245-287 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002147
  • Wilson 1990 302-303 fig.260 n.105 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001509
  • Manganaro 1993 554 ph https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001827
  • Bitto 1996 279 n.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002146
  • Soraci 2017 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001572
